1222. Jackson Almira Florence (Mrs. S.G.)
PIONEER EXPERIENCES

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as anyone else. Some of the questions here will not apply to everyone; others may prove impossible for you to answer, or do not refer to your experiences at all. You should therefore be prepared to leave blank spaces to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of this pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires which have been prepared or projected are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer:

( ) All questionnaires
( ) Pioneer diet
( ) Pioneer schools
( ) Pioneer churches and social life
( ) Pioneer recreation and experiences
( ) Folklore in Saskatchewan
( ) Pioneer health and housing

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Office of the Saskatchewan Archives at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates wherever possible.

I was president of the Ladies Aid Society and secretary of the United Church. My husband has acted on the church board. He was also secretary of the Grain Growers for a time. I am a member of the local Chamber of Commerce and president of the Women's Club.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were "first" to have or do something in the district mention it here giving dates wherever possible. (Such as owning the first automobile, combine, organizing the first lodge, etc.).

38. How did the places in your community get their names? (School districts, Post Offices, villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.). Try to give: (1) name and occupation of person suggesting place-name (2) origin and meaning of the name (3) date of its adoption (4) any changes in names since the first name was given, date and reason for change. Give facts of new name as above in (1), (2), (3).

The Pinecroft School District received its name when one of the local ladies, thinking of Kenora in Ont., happened to say Pinecroft, and all seemed to like the name.

The town of Eldon received its name from the owner of the land who gave the land for the town site.

Our Children: Dorothy Jackson—a missionary in the Belgian Congo; Earl at home; (handwriting not legible); Estelle—now Mrs. Jack Page at Norwood, Ont.; and Evelyn at home. Earl & Estelle both have a family.

Free hospitalization & the installation of the Hydro.
